intro: Jacquemontia acropetala, commonly known as the showy morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is characterized by its vigorous climbing habit. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological restoration projects.
